Jun Liu

2nd year Graduate Student, Former DevOps Engineer
Blog (in Chinese)
CV (PDF)

I am a master student in CARAS Lab at Tokyo Tech, supervised by Prof. Hiroshi Sasaki.

My research interests mainly lie on computer architecture, especially hardware-based CPU performance analysis. My personal interests including cloud computing (virtualization and networking) and operating systems.

I got a bachelorâ€™s degree in network engineering from the University of Electronic Science and Technology of China (UESTC) in 2017. Then I joined NetEase as a DevOps engineer. In there, I was in charge of the load balance cluster of NetEase Games private cloud, dealing with Nginx and Linux networking.

Experiences

  • Sep 2021 - Now: MS in Information and Communications Engineering, Tokyo Tech.
  • Aug 2017 - Jan 2020: DevOps Engineer, NetEase.
  • Sep 2013 - July 2017: BEng in Network Engineering, UESTC.
